verses.verse: Joseph <S%H3130><s%> fell <S%H5307><s%> on his father <S%H1><s%>'s face, <S%H6440><s%> wept <S%H1058><s%> on him, <S%H5401><s%> and kissed him.

Joseph <S%H3130><s%> commanded <S%H6680><s%> his servants, <S%H5650><s%> the physicians, <S%H7495><s%> to embalm <S%H2590><s%> his father; <S%H1><s%> and the physicians <S%H7495><s%> embalmed <S%H2590><s%> Israel. <S%H3478><s%>

Forty <S%H705><s%> days <S%H3117><s%> were fulfilled <S%H4390><s%> for him, <S%H4390><s%> for that is how many the days <S%H3117><s%> it takes to embalm. <S%H2590><s%> The Egyptians <S%H4714><s%> wept for him for seventy <S%H7657><s%> days. <S%H3117><s%>

When the days <S%H3117><s%> of weeping <S%H1068><s%> for him were past, <S%H5674><s%> Joseph <S%H3130><s%> spoke <S%H1696><s%> to the house <S%H1004><s%> of Pharaoh, <S%H6547><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%> "If now I have found <S%H4672><s%> favor <S%H2580><s%> in your eyes, <S%H5869><s%> please speak <S%H1696><s%> in the ears <S%H241><s%> of Pharaoh, <S%H6547><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%>

<S%H1><s%> 'My father made me swear, <S%H7650><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%> "Behold, <S%H2009><s%> I am dying. <S%H4191><s%> Bury me in my grave <S%H6913><s%> which I have dug <S%H3738><s%> for myself in the land <S%H776><s%> of Canaan. <S%H3667><s%>" Now therefore, <S%H6912><s%> please let me go up <S%H5927><s%> and bury <S%H6912><s%> my father, <S%H1><s%> and I will come again. <S%H7725><s%>'"
Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "Go up, <S%H5927><s%> and bury <S%H6912><s%> your father, <S%H1><s%> just like he made you swear. <S%H7650><s%>"

Joseph <S%H3130><s%> went up <S%H5927><s%> to bury <S%H6912><s%> his father; <S%H1><s%> and with him went up <S%H5927><s%> all the servants <S%H5650><s%> of Pharaoh, <S%H6547><s%> the elders <S%H2205><s%> of his house, <S%H1004><s%> all the elders <S%H2205><s%> of the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt, <S%H4714><s%>

all the house <S%H1004><s%> of Joseph, <S%H3130><s%> his brothers, <S%H251><s%> and his father <S%H1><s%>'s house. <S%H1004><s%> Only their little ones, <S%H2945><s%> their flocks, <S%H6629><s%> and their herds, <S%H1241><s%> they left <S%H5800><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%> of Goshen. <S%H1657><s%>
There went up <S%H5927><s%> with him both chariots <S%H7393><s%> and horsemen. <S%H6571><s%> It was a very <S%H3966><s%> great <S%H3515><s%> company. <S%H4264><s%>

They came <S%H935><s%> to the threshing <S%H1637><s%> floor <S%H1637><s%> of Atad, <S%H329><s%> which is beyond <S%H5676><s%> the Jordan, <S%H3383><s%> and there they lamented <S%H5594><s%> with a very <S%H3966><s%> great <S%H1419><s%> and severe <S%H3515><s%> lamentation. <S%H4553><s%> He mourned <S%H60><s%> for his father <S%H1><s%> seven <S%H7651><s%> days. <S%H3117><s%>

When the inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> of the land, <S%H776><s%> the Canaanites, <S%H3669><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> the mourning <S%H60><s%> in the floor <S%H1637><s%> of Atad, <S%H329><s%> they said, <S%H559><s%> "This is a grievous <S%H3515><s%> mourning <S%H60><s%> by the Egyptians. <S%H4714><s%>" Therefore, <S%H8034><s%> its name was called <S%H7121><s%> Abel Mizraim, <S%H67><s%> which is beyond <S%H5676><s%> the Jordan. <S%H3383><s%>
His sons <S%H1121><s%> did <S%H6213><s%> to him just as he commanded them, <S%H6680><s%>

for his sons <S%H1121><s%> carried <S%H5375><s%> him into the land <S%H776><s%> of Canaan, <S%H3667><s%> and buried <S%H6912><s%> him in the cave <S%H4631><s%> of the field <S%H7704><s%> of Machpelah, <S%H4375><s%> which Abraham <S%H85><s%> bought <S%H7069><s%> with the field, <S%H7704><s%> for a possession <S%H272><s%> of a burial <S%H6913><s%> site, <S%H6085><s%> from Ephron the Hittite, <S%H2850><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> Mamre. <S%H4471><s%>

Joseph <S%H3130><s%> returned <S%H7725><s%> into Egypt <S%H4714><s%>â€” he, <S%H251><s%> and his brothers, and all that went up <S%H5927><s%> with him to bury <S%H6912><s%> his father, <S%H1><s%> after <S%H310><s%> he had buried <S%H6912><s%> his father. <S%H1><s%>

When Joseph <S%H3130><s%>'s brothers <S%H251><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> that their father <S%H1><s%> was dead, <S%H4191><s%> they said, <S%H559><s%> "It may be <S%H3863><s%> that Joseph <S%H3130><s%> will hate us, <S%H7852><s%> and will fully pay <S%H7725><s%> us <S%H7852><s%> back for all of the evil <S%H7451><s%> which we did to him. <S%H1580><s%>"
They sent a message <S%H6680><s%> to Joseph, <S%H3130><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%> "Your father <S%H1><s%> commanded <S%H6680><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> he died, <S%H4194><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%>

<S%H577><s%> 'You shall tell <S%H559><s%> Joseph, <S%H3130><s%> "Now please forgive <S%H5375><s%> the disobedience <S%H2403><s%> of your <S%H577><s%> brothers, <S%H251><s%> and their sin, <S%H6588><s%> because they did <S%H1580><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%> to you. <S%H5375><s%>"' Now, please forgive the disobedience of the servants <S%H5650><s%> of the God <S%H430><s%> of your father. <S%H1><s%>" Joseph <S%H3130><s%> wept <S%H1058><s%> when they spoke to him. <S%H1696><s%>
His brothers <S%H251><s%> also went <S%H3212><s%> and fell down <S%H5307><s%> before his face; <S%H6440><s%> and they said, <S%H559><s%> "Behold, <S%H5650><s%> we are your servants."
Joseph <S%H3130><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to them, <S%H3372><s%> "Don't be afraid, for am I in the place of God? <S%H430><s%>

As for you, <S%H2803><s%> you meant evil <S%H7451><s%> against me, <S%H430><s%> but God meant it <S%H2803><s%> for good, <S%H2896><s%> to <S%H4616><s%> bring to pass, <S%H6213><s%> as it is this day, <S%H3117><s%> to save <S%H2421><s%> many <S%H7227><s%> people <S%H5971><s%> alive. <S%H2421><s%>

Now therefore don't <S%H3372><s%> be afraid. I will nourish <S%H3557><s%> you and your little ones. <S%H2945><s%>" He comforted <S%H5162><s%> them, <S%H1696><s%> and spoke kindly to them. <S%H3820><s%>

Joseph <S%H3130><s%> lived <S%H3427><s%> in Egypt, <S%H4714><s%> he, <S%H1><s%> and his father's house. <S%H1004><s%> Joseph <S%H3130><s%> lived <S%H2421><s%> one hundred <S%H3967><s%> ten <S%H6235><s%> years. <S%H8141><s%>

Joseph <S%H3130><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> Ephraim <S%H669><s%>'s children <S%H1121><s%> to the third <S%H8029><s%> generation. <S%H1121><s%> The children also of Machir, <S%H4353><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Manasseh, <S%H4519><s%> were born on <S%H3205><s%> Joseph <S%H3130><s%>'s knees. <S%H1290><s%>

Joseph <S%H3130><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to his brothers, <S%H251><s%> "I am dying, <S%H4191><s%> but God <S%H430><s%> will surely <S%H6485><s%> visit <S%H6485><s%> you, <S%H5927><s%> and bring you up out of this land <S%H776><s%> to the land <S%H776><s%> which he swore <S%H7650><s%> to Abraham, <S%H85><s%> to Isaac, <S%H3327><s%> and to Jacob. <S%H3290><s%>"

Joseph <S%H3130><s%> took an oath <S%H7650><s%> of the children <S%H1121><s%> of Israel, <S%H3478><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%> "God <S%H430><s%> will surely <S%H6485><s%> visit <S%H6485><s%> you, <S%H5927><s%> and you shall carry up my bones <S%H6106><s%> from here. <S%H2088><s%>"

So Joseph <S%H3130><s%> died, <S%H4191><s%> being one hundred <S%H3967><s%> ten <S%H6235><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> old, <S%H1121><s%> and they embalmed <S%H2590><s%> him, <S%H3455><s%> and he was put in a coffin <S%H727><s%> in Egypt. <S%H4714><s%>
